description: : This module contains functions to connect to any JDBC datasource  : using jvm-util module to handle Java interaction. : : @author Rodolfo Ochoa : @project DB Drivers/JDBC

functions.name: affected-rows
functions.description: : Return the number of affected rows of a particular DataSet. : : @param $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet. :  : @error SQL008 DataSet doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
functions.summary: : Return the number of affected rows of a particular DataSet.

functions.name: clear-params
functions.description: : Clears the current parameter values immediately. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Clears the current parameter values immediately.

functions.name: close-dataset
functions.description: : Closes and free resources from a particular DataSet. : : @param $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet. :  : @error SQL008 DataSet doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Closes and free resources from a particular DataSet.

functions.name: close-prepared
functions.description: : Closes and frees from memory any prepared SQL statement created with jdbc:prepare-statement : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Closes and frees from memory any prepared SQL statement created with jdbc:prepare-statement : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement.

functions.name: commit
functions.description: : Commit current transaction from an active connection. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be commited. :  : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Commit current transaction from an active connection.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: : Opens a connection to a database. : Returns a URI identifying the connection that has been opened. The implementing code determines from the $connection-config either explicitly (interpreting the driver attribute) or implicitly (using the type attribute) which driver it has to load. : : @param $connection-config json object that has the host and user informations. : @option "url" URL of the server, this option must be specified and should be declared according to JDBC specification. : @option "user" username for the server, this is optional. : @option "password" password for the server, this is optional. : : @error SQL28000 Authentication failed. : @error SQL08001 Connection error. : @error SQL40003 Isolation level not supported. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see attached message. : : @return Return an identifier that represents the connection to the server. : : Connection coonfiguration example: : { "url" : "jdbc:mysql://localhost/",  :   "user" : "root", :   "password" : "" } :
functions.summary: : Opens a connection to a database.

functions.name: connect
functions.signature: ($connection-config as object(), $options as object()?) as xs:anyURI external
functions.description: : Opens a connection to a database with specified options. : Returns a URI identifying the connection that has been opened. The implementing code determines from the $connection-config either explicitly (interpreting the driver attribute) or implicitly (using the type attribute) which driver it has to load. : : @param $connection-config json object that has the host and user informations. : @option "url" URL of the server, this option must be specified and should be declared according to JDBC specification. : @option "user" username for the server, this option is optional. : @option "password" password for the server, this option is optional. : @param $options json object that specifies the connection options. : @option "autocommit" The created connection will have autocommit turned on if the value the attribute is set to "true". : @option "readonly" The created connection will be readonly if the value of the attribute is set to "true". : @option "isolation-level" The created connection will have the specified transaction isolation level,  : the following string typed in-scope variables represent the different transaction isolation levels  : that this attribute can be set to: : - $jsql:READ-COMMITTED : - $jsql:READ-UNCOMMITTED : - $jsql:REPEATABLE-READ : - $jsql:SERIALIZABLE : if no isolation level is provided by the user the connection will be created with the default  : isolation level of the database. : : : @error SQL28000 Authentication failed. : @error SQL08001 Connection error. : @error SQL40003 Isolation level not supported. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an identifier that represents the connection to the server. : : Connection options example: : { "autocommit" : false,  :   "readonly"? : true, :   "isolation-level"? : $jdbc:READ-COMMITTED } :
functions.summary: : Opens a connection to a database with specified options.

functions.name: connection-options
functions.description: : Returns a set with options for a specified connection. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be verify. : : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message : : @return Returns and object with the connection options. : The returned options are equal to the options specified in function jdbc:connect.  : Consequently, the options are specified as follows: :    { "autocommit" : xs:boolean, :      "readonly" : xs:boolean, :      "isolation-level" : xs:string } :
functions.summary: : Returns a set with options for a specified connection.

functions.name: execute-prepared
functions.description: : Executes SQL statements prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement with values set : and returns an identifier to a Dataset. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an identifier that represents a DataSet.
functions.summary: : Executes SQL statements prepared with 5.

functions.name: execute-query-prepared
functions.description: : Executes a non-updating SQL statement prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL005 The prepared statement is an updating query. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an object with the result data rows from the query processed with the parameter values provided, :  the data rows are defined as follows: :   { column:value* }* :  Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
functions.summary: : Executes a non-updating SQL statement prepared with 5.

functions.name: execute-query
functions.signature: ($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as object()* external
functions.description: : Executes non-updating SQL statements. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to an active connection. : @param $sql The query string to be executed. :  : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL005 The statement is Updating type. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, :  the data rows are defined as follows: :   { column:value* }* :  Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result. :
functions.summary: : Executes non-updating SQL statements.

functions.name: execute-update-prepared
functions.description: : Executes an updating SQL statement prepared with 5.1 jsql:prepare-statement. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL006 The prepared statement is a non-updating query. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
functions.summary: : Executes an updating SQL statement prepared with 5.

functions.name: execute-update
functions.signature: ($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:integer external
functions.description: : Executes updating SQL statements. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to an active connection. : @param $sql The query string to be executed. :  : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL005 The statement is Read-only type. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Returns an xs:integer with the number of affected rows.
functions.summary: : Executes updating SQL statements.

functions.name: execute
functions.signature: ($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external
functions.description: : Executes any kind of SQL statement.  : : @param $connection-id The identifier to an active connection. : @param $sql The query string to be executed. :  : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an identifier that represents a DataSet.
functions.summary: : Executes any kind of SQL statement.

functions.name: is-connected
functions.description: : Verify if a connection is still active. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be verify. : : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message : : @return Returns true if connected.
functions.summary: : Verify if a connection is still active.

functions.name: metadata
functions.description: : Return the metadata of the result of a particular DataSet. : : @param $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet. :  : @error SQL008 DataSet doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns the metadata associated with an executed DataSet. More in detail, it returns information about column names, types, and whether a column can contain a null value. : The metadata information can only be returned for DataSets that have been executed explicitly using the jsql:execute function. :  : The metadata node returned by this function is defined as follows: : { :   "columns": [ { :       "name": xs:string, :       "type": xs:string, :       "autoincrement"? = xs:boolean, :       "nillable"? = xs:boolean } * ] : } : @option "name" The name of the column. : @option "type" The SQL type of the column. : @option "autoincrement" is true if this column is automatically maintained. : @option "nillable" If the colums can contain NULL values this attribute will be set to true. : : If the query is an updating query, then the result object will return the number of affected rows like: : { "affectedrows": xs:integer }
functions.summary: : Return the metadata of the result of a particular DataSet.

functions.name: parameter-metadata
functions.description: : Retrieves the number, types and properties of the prepared statement parameters. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns the parameters metadata associated with a prepared statement.  : In other words, it returns information about the column name associated with the parameter, the type, etc. : The metadata node returned by this function is defined as follows: :   { :     columns: [{ :       "name": xs:string, :       "type": xs:string :       }] :   } : @option "name" The name of the column. : @option "type" The SQL type of the column.
functions.summary: : Retrieves the number, types and properties of the prepared statement parameters.

functions.name: prepare-statement
functions.signature: ($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $sql as xs:string) as xs:anyURI external
functions.description: :  Creates a prepared statement for multiple executions with diferent values. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to an active connection. : @param $sql The query string to be executed. :  : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an identifier that represents the prepared statement. : : Example: : jsql:prepare-statement($connection, "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id=? AND age>?")
functions.summary: : Creates a prepared statement for multiple executions with diferent values.

functions.name: result-set
functions.description: : This function returns a sequence of objects representing the rows of data from a non-updating query. : : @param $dataset-id The identifier to a DataSet. :  : @error SQL008 DataSet doesn't exist. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an object with the result data rows from the DataSet provided, :  the data rows are defined as follows: :   { column:value* }* :  Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
functions.summary: : This function returns a sequence of objects representing the rows of data from a non-updating query.

functions.name: rollback
functions.description: : Rollback the current transaction of a connection. : : @param $connection-id The identifier to the connection to be rollbacked. : : @error SQL08003 Connection doesn't exist : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Rollback the current transaction of a connection.

functions.name: set-boolean
functions.signature: ($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer, $value as xs:boolean) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only boolean values. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. : @param $parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set. : @param $value The value to be set. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL007 Parameter casting error. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only boolean values.

functions.name: set-null
functions.signature: ($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only null values if possible. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. : @param $parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL007 Parameter casting error. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only null values if possible.

functions.name: set-numeric
functions.signature: ($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:decimal, $value as xs:anyAtomicType) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only numeric values. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. : @param $parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set. : @param $value The value to be set. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL007 Parameter casting error. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only numeric values.

functions.name: set-string
functions.signature: ($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:integer, $value as xs:string) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only string values. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. : @param $parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set. : @param $value The value to be set. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL007 Parameter casting error. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, this function will assign only string values.

functions.name: set-value
functions.signature: ($prepared-statement as xs:anyURI, $parameter-index as xs:decimal, $value as xs:anyAtomicType) as empty-sequence() external
functions.description: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value,  : this function will assign any value you send  : and it will try to cast to the correct type. : : @param $prepared-statement The identifier to a prepared statement. : @param $parameter-index The index from the parameter to be set. : @param $value The value to be set. :  : @error SQL003 Prepared statement doesn't exist. : @error SQL007 Parameter casting error. : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return This function returns an empty-sequence()
functions.summary: : Set the value of the designated parameter with the given value, : this function will assign any value you send : and it will try to cast to the correct type.

functions.name: tables
functions.description: : : Return the list of tables from a connection : : @param $connection-id The identifier to a connection. : : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, :  the data rows are defined as follows: :   { column:value* }* :  Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.
functions.summary: : : Return the list of tables from a connection : : @param $connection-id The identifier to a connection.

functions.name: tables
functions.signature: ($connection-id as xs:anyURI, $catalog as xs:string?, $schema as xs:string?, $table as xs:string?) as object()* external
functions.description: : Return the list of tables from a connection : : @param $connection-id The identifier to a connection. : @param $catalog A filter of the catalog name of the tables. :             Send empty-sequence for all tables. : @param $schema A filter of the schema name of the tables. :             Send empty-sequence for all tables. : @param $table A filter of the name of the tables. :             Send empty-sequence for all tables. :  : @error SQL08000 Connection is closed. : @error SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message. : : @return Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, :  the data rows are defined as follows: :   { column:value* }* :  Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result. :
functions.summary: : Return the list of tables from a connection : : @param $connection-id The identifier to a connection.

variables.name: jdbc:NOT-SUPPORTED
variables.description: : This variable represents the NOT-SUPPORTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.

variables.name: jdbc:READ-COMMITTED
variables.description: : This variable represents the READ-COMMITTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.

variables.name: jdbc:READ-UNCOMMITTED
variables.description: : This variable represents the READ-UNCOMMITTED level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.

variables.name: jdbc:REPEATABLE-READ
variables.description: : This variable represents the REPEATABLE-READ level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.

variables.name: jdbc:SERIALIZABLE
variables.description: : This variable represents the SERIALIZABLE level for Isolation Levels in $options for 2.2 connect function.
